Project Name: Aalborg - Northern Jutland Power Station Project
Project Summary: Vattenfall is planning to have a full-scale CCS demonstration project in operation in Aalborg in Northern Denmark by 2013. A series of geological surveys has been undertaken to identify suitable storage in the plant's vicinity. The project is on hold.
The CO2 is scrubbed from the flue gas stream via an ABB Lummus scrubber system that uses monoethanolamine (MEA) as its solvent. Produces 200 tons/day CO2 that is used for food-grade applications.
This plant captures around 96% of its CO2 emissions and then sells this captured CO2 to companies to use in fire extinguishers and dry ice.

Project Name: Air Products and Chemicals Inc. CCS Project
Plant Name: Valero Port Arthur Refinery's Methane Steam Reformer Waste Streams
Project Summary: DOE project was completed on September 30, 2017, and operations continue.

Plant Name: North West Upgrading Inc. and Agrium Inc
Project Summary: The Alberta Carbon Trunk Line (ACTL) is capable of gathering CO2 from several sources and transporting the CO2 to existing mature oil fields for EOR. The total pipeline distance is about 150 miles.

Project Name: Alberta Saline Aquifer Project & Genesee Demonstration Project
Project Summary: The Alberta Saline Aquifer Project will identify deep saline aquifers in Alberta for use in a carbon sequestration pilot project. Ph II will construct/operate a demo pilot (3,300 metric tons/day) plant at Genesee power plant. CO2 to be stored in saline.

Plant Name: Natural Source from Cortez Area of New Mexico
Project Summary: This project involves CO2 injection into the Allison Unit of the San Juan Basin. CO2 was used to enhance coalbed methane recovery.

The project is an EGR project to be performed in Europe's second-largest natural gas field - the Altmark gas field. The program plans to control old wells, along with advancement of monitoring techniques, process modelling, and risk assessment.

Project Name: American Electric Power - Great Bend IGCC
Project Summary: The project was to build a new American Electric Power clean coal power plant in Meigs County, Ohio, but the project is on hold.
Phase I: Start 2009 - Scheduled to operate for 18 months (up to 5 years). Phase II: 2015 - Phase II has been cancelled due to unknown climate policy.
Full-scale (1.5 million metric tons) test of Alstom's ammonia-based carbon capture technology. 90% of the CO2 produced will be captured. Has contract to sell CO2 to SemGreen LLP for EOR.

Project Name: American Electric Power - Red Rock Facility
Project Summary: Pre-approval for permit denied; OCC didn’t look at alternative energy sources. No mention of CCS with this project.

Project Name: American Electric Power - Tanners Creek Plant
Project Summary: After reviewing results of the retrofit feasibility study, Tanners Creek #4 unit will be retired by mid-2015. Units #1 through #3 will also be taken offline by mid-2015.

Project Name: An Evaluation of the Carbon Sequestration Potential of the Cambro Ordovician Strata of the Illinois and Michigan Basins
Project Summary: Goal is to evaluate carbon storage potential of Cambrian-Ordovician strata in Illinois and Michigan basins by evaluating reservoir and seal capacity, mapping the basins with 2D & 3D seismic data sets, and developing a BMP for site characterization.

Aquistore is an independent research and monitoring project that intends to demonstrate storing liquid CO2 deep underground; in partnership with the Boundary Dam CCS project. The project stored 107,000 cumulative metric tons of CO2 as of February 15, 2017.

Project Name: ARI Eastern Shale CO2 Injection Test
Project Summary: ARI is conducting a small-scale CO2 injection in eastern shales. CO2 is planned to come from the AES Warrior Run plant, but it is not a full capture project. The test will assess the feasibility of injecting and storing CO2 in shale formations.
Aviva Corporation and AES were planning to build a new 2x200-MW oxy-fuel-ready power station with the potential to capture and store up to 90% of its CO2 emissions.

Project Name: Baard Energy - Ohio River Clean Fuels
Project Summary: This project involves the development of a carbon management plan for a proposed coal and biomass to liquids (CBTL) plant. The plant is now being operated by natural gas, not liquified coal, in order to facilitate project completion.

Project to capture approximately 100,000 metric tons per year of CO2 using Alstom’s amines technology. Second phase of project was to build a larger CCS plant at the Belchatow 2 Power Station. In May 2012, PGE announced it was suspending project due to costs.

The plant will use petroleum coke and gasification technology to produce electricity, as well as hydrogen, nitrogen, steam, and carbon dioxide for industrial use. The CO2 may be used for EOR at the Weyburn Test site. Up to 90% capture expected.

The plant is a gas-fired 320-MWe combined cycle unit in Bellingham, Massachusetts. It is a baseload and provides electricity to Boston Edison Company, Commonwealth Electric, and Montaup Electric. 320-350 tons/day is captured and sold for food processing.
Xcel suspended consideration in November 2007, too expensive for perceived demand. Promised to reconsider this concept in a few years.

Project Name: Big Sky Development Phase - Kevin Dome Project
Project Summary: This project will inject 1 million metric tons of naturally occurring CO2 from the Kevin Dome into the Duperow Formation in order to demonstrate storage integrity and permanence. After post-injection monitoring, EOR feasibility will also be evaluated.

Project Name: Big Sky Validation Phase - Basalt Injection
Project Summary: Injection was initiated on July 17, 2013. Injection completed August 11, 2013.

The proposed methodology is not yet approved by UNFCCC as eligible CDM. The proposed project involves capture of CO2 from LNG plant in Bintulu, Malaysia. CO2 will be transported 120 km by pipeline and injected into a sub-sea saline formation.

Project Name: Blackhorse Energy LLC - Small-Scale Injection Project
Plant Name: EOR operations in the Livingston Reservoir (First Wilcox Sand)
Project Summary: This project will utilize CO2 for EOR operations in the First Wilcox sand unit. The project will inject 52,000 metric tons of CO2 and CO2 foam for EOR operations.

The captured CO2 is sold and transported by pipeline to nearby oil fields in southern Saskatchewan where it will be used for enhanced oil recovery. CO2 not used for enhanced oil recovery will be stored in the Aquistore Project.
Supercritical PC plant in which removed CO2 will be used for EOR in nearby oil fields.

Project Name: BP-Peterhead Hydrogen Power Plant/Miller Field Project
Plant Name: Scottish & Southern Energy’s Peterhead Power Station
Project Summary: BP’s initial hydrogen power project at Peterhead, Scotland was terminated. In 2011, Shell re-proposed to capture post-combustion CO2 from an existing plant and pipe it to Goldeneye Gas field (North Sea) for EOR. A full design study began in 2012.
The project was to develop three gas fields with plans to study the potential to transport and store CO2 removed from feed gas.

Plant Name: Bulgarian Thermal Power Plant Maritza East 2
Project Summary: The effort was to add a post-combustion capture (120 MW) to the coal generating plant and capture and pipe the CO2 to inject for offshore saline storage.

Project Name: CAB-CS: Central Appalachian Basin CarbonSAFE Integrated Pre-Feasibility Project
Project Summary: This project will  perform pre-feasibility studies for an integrated commercial-scale carbon capture and storage (CCS) site that will utilize deep geologic strata in the Central Appalachian Basin.

Project Name: California CO2 Storage Assurance Facility Enterprise (C2SAFE)
Project Summary: Conduct an initial assessment of the southern San Joaquin Valley (SSJV) in California, specifically, of the technical, economic, social, and regulatory challenges and solutions related to the development of a commercial-scale, integrated CCS facility.
The proposed IGCC plant (with carbon capture technology) would use Siemens gasifiers to convert the coal feedstock into a hydrogen-rich synthetic gas (syngas) and CO2.

CO2 obtained from the Hellisheidi geothermal power plant's steam recovery will be concentrated, dissolved in water, and injected into nearby basalts between 400 m and 800 m. Use this to study mineralization of CO2 in basalts.

Project Name: Carbon Dioxide Technology Corp - Lubbock Plant
Project Summary: Product CO2 was pipelined from the recovery plant in a supercritical state at about 2,000 psig to the Post oil field in Garza County, Texas, about 35 miles away for use in an EOR project.

CarbonNet, organized by the Victorian Government, is a CO2 storage hub collecting captured CO2 from Latrobe Valley industry. It aims to capture 3 and 5 Mt of CO2 per annum from a number of high emissions sources and inject in a common reservoir.

Specific Site Location: East sub-basin of the Illinois Basin
Project Summary: Conduct a pre-feasibility assessment for commercial-scale CO2 geological storage complexes in the East sub-basin of the Illinois Basin.
The project will work to establish the feasibility of a commercial-scale CO2 geologic storage complex within the Mt. Simon sandstone formation located in Macon County, Illinois.

Project Name: CarbonSAFE Rocky Mountain Phase I: Ensuring Safe Subsurface Storage of Carbon Dioxide in the Intermountain West
Project Summary: Identify the conditions and attributes that will facilitate feasible and practical commercial-scale carbon capture and storage.
The proposed project was to build a 770-MW IGCC coal plant  to gasify 2.8 million tons of coal per year to produce electricity and deliver CO2 to an interstate pipeline.

Project Name: CASTOR CO2 from Capture to Storage
Project Summary: Tested in a pilot unit capable of treating 0.9 metric tons of CO2/hr.

Project plan is to capture 1.1 million metric tons of CO2 per year from a new power plant at the Maasvlakte and will store the captured CO2 in a depleted gas reservoir under the North Sea via a 25-km pipeline (5 km onshore, 20 km offshore in depleted gas field).

CATO-2 research is in five subprogrammes: CO2 capture, transport and CCS chain integration, subsurface storage of CO2 and monitoring storage, regulation and safety, and public perception. Expands on post-combustion capture research at this plant.

Project Name: CEMEX Inc. Cement CO2 Capture Project
Project Summary: This DOE Phase I ICCS project was selected for Phase I but not for Phase II.

Occidental Petroleum signed an agreement with SandRidge Energy in 2008 to develop the gas processing plant and related pipeline infrastructure. The first train came online in late 2010, and the second train is due to be operational by 2012.

Project Name: Characterization of the Miocene and Pliocene Formations in the Wilmington Graben, Offshore Los Angeles, for Large-Scale Geologic Storage of CO2
Project Summary: Geologic storage potential study in the Wilmington Graben, offshore LA Basin.

Project Name: Characterization of the Most Promising Sequestration Formations in the Rocky Mountain Region
Project Summary: Project seeks to characterize and analyze the geologic storage formations near the Craig Power Station in Colorado and apply the results to regional geologic storage formations in the Central and Southwestern Rockies.

Project Name: China Resources Power (Haifeng) Integrated Carbon Capture and Sequestration Demonstration Project
Plant Name: China Resources Power (CRP) & China National Offshore Oil Corporation (CNOOC)
Project Summary: Injects in a CO2 storage site in a deep saline formation in the South China Sea for permanent storage or for EOR.

Project Name: CO2 Capture from Coffeyville Fertilizer Plant
Project Summary: Coffeyville Resources Nitrogen Fertilizers sends CO2 for use in enhanced oil recovery operations at Chaparral’s North Burbank Oil Unit in Osage County, northeastern Oklahoma.

Plant Name: Multiple Plants Integrated Through CO2 Pipelines
Project Summary: This project aims at paving the road towards large-scale, Europe-wide infrastructure for the transport and injection of CO2 from zero-emission plants. The project will result in a roadmap for CO2 transport infrastructure.
Located at Ketzin, Germany, the project injected 67,271 metric tons of CO2. Injection ended August 29, 2013.

Build facility to convert coal into syngas and CO2 using chemical processes. Around 2.3 mte CO2/yr would be separated/piped to EOR and saline storage in the North Sea. Syngas to go to adjacent power plant to be built. Currently being re-evaled. Not funded.

Company: Western Australian Department of Mines and Petroleum
Project Summary: This is a CCS research and demonstration project aimed at collecting captured carbon dioxide from coal-fired power stations and other industry in the area southwest of Perth in Western Australia and injecting it into saline.

Plant Name: Immingham Combined Heat and Power Plant
Project Summary: A feasibility study is looking at coal to hydrogen expansion at the Immingham CHP. CO2 will be captured, transported, and stored below the North Sea.

Project Name: CONSOL Energy - Sequestration of CO2 in Unmineable Coal Seams
Project Summary: CONSOL demonstrated a novel drilling and production process that reduces potential methane emissions from coal mining, produces usable methane (natural gas), and creates a sequestration sink for CO2 in unmineable coal seams.

Specific Site Location: Town of Biloela in the Banana Shire
Project Summary: The project retrofitted a 30-MW unit at CS Energy's Callide A with oxyfuel process and captured CO2 from the waste gases. The project has capture rates of more than 85% and has operated more than 2,500 hrs.

Project Name: CSIRO Transportable Capture Unit Loy Yang (Victoria)
Company: CSIRO - Australian Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organization
Project Summary: Australia's CSIRO has a mobile post-combustion capture technology at Loy Yang Power Station and is capturing 1,000 metric tons/year of CO2. They are also investigating a range of solvent capture technologies.

Project Name: CSIRO Transportable Capture Unit Munmorah (New South Wales)
Company: CSIRO - Australian Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organization
Project Summary: CSIRO performed a post-combustion capture (and release) project at Munmorah Power station using a post-combustion ammonia absorption technology. Up to 3,000 metric tons of CO2 were captured during the tests. Pilot plant was relocated to Vales Point in 2012.

Company: CSIRO - Australian Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organization
Project Summary: Amine-based post-combustion capture pilot plant will capture 1,000 tpa of CO2 over a two-year period. The plant became operational in December 2010.
Dagang will use one of its two 330-MW power units to demonstrate the capture of CO2 and then transport the CO2 for sequestration and EOR.

Plant Name: New Build Plant with Oxy-Firing Technology
Project Summary: Alstom signed an agreement in November 2011 stating that it will carry out the study for the 350-MW oxy-combustion CCS demonstration project located in Daqing.
Plan was to produce 20,000 - 22,000 barrels per day from coal.
The project has completed a FEED study and received planning approval. Bought by SARGAS in July 2014. SARGAS plans to switch to natural gas fuel.

Project Name: DONG Energy - High-Efficiency PC Plant in Griefswalde
Project Summary: The 1,600-MW proposed power plant plan was withdrawn due to a lack of political backing.
Proposed construction of a 750-MW IGCC power plant with pre-combustion CO2 capture; 150 KM transport to EOR field in Shangdong Province.
The project built one 800-MW supercritical unit, originally to have carbon mitigation.
The project was to build a 618-MW IGCC, plant with CCS, in Knox County, Indiana. The CCS capability was not installed, and the plant was completed.

Project Name: E.ON Coal Plant in Wilhelmshaven, Germany
Project Summary: The pilot plant will be small in scale at 5.5 MW and will capture approximately 70 metric tons per day of CO2. Completed in late 2015.

Project Name: E.ON Kingsnorth Ruhrgas UK Post-Combustion Project
Project Summary: Project was cancelled in March 2012 due to economic hurdles to construction.

Project Name: E.ON Pilot Plant in Heyden, Germany
Project Summary: The project plans to improve the efficiency of post combustion capturing by testing different solvents. The pilot plant is expected to begin its operation in 2009 and plans to produce 7 MW.
Large-scale IGCC Plant with CCS. Capture up to 2.5 Mt/yr of CO2, compress and transport to gas fields under the North Sea. In March 2015 E.ON announced the cancellation of the project.
A post-combustion capture process developed by Siemens will be used to remove over 90% of the CO2 from the flue gases of one of the units at the E.ON plant.
The project will conduct an investigation of alternative EOR processes having potential application in the giant Ekofisk chalk field.

ENECOGEN intends to build an 850-MW natural-gas fired plant using cryogenic CO2 capture to initially capture about 9K metric tons of CO2/year. The cryogenic capture process will use about 50% of their cooling need from Liongas LNG Terminal.

Plant Name: Federico II Brindisi Coal-Fired Power Plant
Project Summary: Enel and Eni signed a strategic cooperation agreement to develop systems for the capture, transport, and geological sequestration of CO2 and for the joint construction of Italy's first carbon capture and storage project. Injection into a saline reservoir.

Project Name: Engineering-Scale Demonstration of Mixed-Salt Process for CO2 Capture
Project Summary: 10 MW - Test transformational solvent-based CO2 capture technologies at engineering scales using existing infrastructure, or membrane-based approaches that can be built and tested at a relevant scale that can be easily replicated for larger systems.

Project Name: Engineering-Scale Testing of Transformational Non-Aqueous Solvent-Based CO2 Capture Process at Technology Centre Mongstad
Capture Technology: RTI International’s transformational Non-Aqueous Solvent (NAS)-Based CO2 Capture Technology
Project Summary: Test transformational solvent-based CO2 capture technologies at engineering scales using existing infrastructure, or membrane-based approaches that can be built and tested at a relevant scale that can be easily replicated for larger systems.

Enel will trap CO2 from a coal-fired power station in Brindisi and transport the CO2 to the Eni-owned Stogit natural gas field in Cortemaggiore. Enel will be capable of capturing 2 metric tons of CO2/hr while Eni plans to inject about 8,000 metric tons of CO2/yr.

Project Name: Establishing An Early Carbon Dioxide Storage (ECO2S) Complex in Kemper County, Mississippi: Project ECO2S
Project Summary: Demonstrate that the subsurface adjacent to the Kemper County energy facility has the potential to store commercial volumes of CO2 safely, permanently, and economically within a regionally significant saline reservoir system.

Project Name: Evaluation of Solid Sorbents as a Retrofit Technology for CO2 Capture
Project Summary: Design, construct, and operate pilot plant on 1 MWe slipstream of flue gas at Southern Company's Plant Miller.
Pilot capture plant that is testing two solvents (MEA and H3-1) on a 0.7 MWe. Ultimate goal is to construct a 550-MWe commercial-scale capture plant.

Fairview ZeroCarbon project (ZCP) will receive A$75 million from the Australian Government for enhanced coal bed methane (ECBM) production and carbon dioxide sequestration. The project will operate a 100-MW plant and sequester the CO2 to a depth of 700 m.

Fenn Big Valley project was a comprehensive project studying CO2 sequestration in deep coal mines while enhancing coal bed methane production (ECBM). In October 1999, Alberta Research Council drilled a well at Fenn Big Valley.

Fertilizer plant recovers CO2 from flue gases at up to 400 metric tons per day based on amine capture technologies from Mitsubishi Heavy Industries. Reduces CO2 emissions by 20% and increased urea production by 30%. Began operation in 2009.
CO2 capture for beneficial re-use (EOR).
Only uses one coal-fired unit and one oil-fired unit currently. Other units were shut down.
From October 4-14, 2004, the Frio Brine Pilot team injected 1,600 tons of CO2 1,500 m below surface into a high permeability brine-bearing sandstone of the Frio Formation.
Jewett, Texas, was one of four sites that was considered for the FutureGen Alliance project. The 400-acre site was not chosen out of the site finalists.
FutureGen project intended to create a zero-emissions fossil fuel plant that would produce hydrogen and byproducts for use by other industries.
Odessa, Texas, was one of four sites that was considered for the FutureGen Alliance project. The  site was not chosen from the site finalists.
Tuscola, Illinois, was one of four sites that was considered for the FutureGen Alliance project. The  site was not chosen from the site finalists.

FutureGen intended to create a zero-emissions fossil fuel plant that produces hydrogen and byproducts for use by other industries. Morgan County, Illinois, was chosen as the site of the FutureGen project. The project was discontinued in 2015.
FutureGas is a CTL plant that will produce synthetic liquid fuels and power generation with CCS. The captured CO2 will be stored in the Otway basin.
Project will construct a 900-MW coal-fired power plant that incorporates carbon capture and storage.

Project Name: Geologic Characterization of the South Georgia Rift Basin for Source Proximal CO2 Storage
Project Summary: Evaluate the feasibility of storing CO2 in the Jurassic and Triassic strata of the buried South Georgia Rift Basin.

Natural gas will be produced from sub-sea wells and transported to Barrow Island via pipelines at Barrow Island, at which the gas will be processed into LNG. CO2 will be separated (approx. 2.5 to 3 million tons/year) and reinjected into the gas field.

The IGCC plant will be a polygeneration plant producing steam, electricity, and hydrogen. The plant will use ConocoPhillips E-Gas technology. Captured CO2 will be used recover up to 1 billion barrels of "stranded oil" from the Michigan Basin using EOR.
EPRI, along with other corporations and companies, is conducting a study on impacts and ability of retrofitting advanced amine-based CO2 capture technology with current plants.

The activities include coal gasification, hydrogen production and power generation, and carbon sequestration. Technical goals are to complete an industrial demonstration project of 400 MW before 2020. Approx. 2 million metric tons of CO2 to be captured.

Project Name: Gulf of Mexico Miocene Mega Transect Site Characterization
Project Summary: Objective is to identify at least one specific site within Texas offshore state lands capable of storing at least 30 million tons of CO2.

Project Name: Gulf Petrochemical Industries Company (GPIC) Capture Project
Project Summary: Captured CO2 from a fertilizer plant will be used as feedstock for urea and methanol synthesis processes. The technology can recover approximately 90% of the CO2 in flue gas and up to 450 metric tons of CO2 per day.

Company: CO2CRC - Cooperative Research Centre for Greenhouse Gas Technologies
Project Summary: Based at Hazelwood power station and run in parallel with the Hazelwood Post-Combustion 2030 Project. Effort has tested a range of solvents and different process configurations using the solvent post-combustion capture plant.

Plant Name: Statoil Hydro Natural Gas Processing Facility
Project Summary: The project was cancelled due to poor financials.

The Heartland Area Redwater Project, located in the Heartland Region of Alberta (Canada), aims to demonstrate the feasibility of CO2 storage in onshore carbonate rocks in North America (the Redwater Leduc Reef). Effort on hold pending CO2 legislation.

The project develops an innovative retrofit low emission technology project at its 1,600-MW brown coal-fired Hazelwood power station in the Latrobe Valley. The project includes a coal drying demonstration phase and a CO2 capture part. Plant closed 2017.
The Hiroshima pilot plant has a CO2 recovery capacity of 2 metric tons per day and commenced operation in 2004.
CEZ is considering two localities for modern low-emission lignite-biomass technologies, Hodonin and North Bohemia.

The IGCC plant will use brown coal as its feedstock which has a high moisture content. The plant will incorporate a pressurized drying process to remove the moisture. HRL will build a 100-MW intermediate-scale plant before full-scale utilization.
The project included two 926-MW power plants and a carbon capture demonstration.
The CO2 was to be captured and pumped under pressure into pipelines for use in enhanced oil recovery in the Texas oilfields.
The IGCC plant was to produce hydrogen from coal and petcoke mixes to combust in combustion turbines and the CO2 will be used for EOR in the Elk Hills Oil Field.

Commercial-scale 400-MWe hydrogen-fired power plant with CCS technology will be built in Abu Dhabi, UAE. The capture capacity will in the order of 1.7 million metric tons of CO2/yr for EOR. Currently in FEED.

The proposed Integrated CO2 Network targets large sources of industrial CO2 emissions in Alberta including coal-fired electrical generation and energy production. The CO2 will be captured and transported to geological sites for sequestration or EOR.

Project Name: Illinois Industrial Carbon Capture and Storage Project
Project Summary: Develop and demonstrate an integrated system of CO2 processing and transport from an ethanol plant to the Mt. Simon Sandstone Formation (saline reservoir) for geologic sequestration.

The In Salah Gas Project is a joint venture targeted to produce natural gas located in the Ahnet - Timmimoun Basin, in Central Algeria. Natural gas will be processed and the CO2 is compressed and injected into wells 1,800 meters deep.

Project Name: Initial Engineering Design of a Post-Combustion CO2 Capture System for Duke Energy’s East Bend Station Using Membrane-Based Technology
Plant Name: East Bend Generating Station, Duke Energy
Project Summary: Complete an initial design of a commercial-scale, post-combustion CO2 capture system for application at an existing coal-fueled generating unit.

Project Name: Initial Engineering, Testing, and Design of a Commercial-Scale, Post-Combustion CO2 Capture System on an Existing Coal-Fired Generating Unit
Plant Name: Minnkota Power Cooperative’s Milton R. Young Station Unit 2
Capture Technology: Mitsubishi Heavy Industries’ (MHI’s) KM CDR Process™ Using the KS-1™ Solvent
Project Summary: Complete an initial design of a commercial-scale, post-combustion CO2 capture system for application at an existing coal-fueled generating unit.

Project Name: Integrated Carbon Capture and Storage in Kansas
Company: University of Kansas Center for Research
Project Summary: Conduct a feasibility study of three of Kansas’ largest CO2 point sources, nearby storage sites (with greater than 50 million metric tons capacity), and potential CO2 transportation networks.

Project Name: Integrated Carbon Capture and Storage in the Louisiana Chemical Corridor
Project Summary: Conduct a detailed sub-basinal evaluation of the potential for CO2 storage in both depleted oil and gas fields and saline reservoirs in South Louisiana.

Project Name: Integrated CCS Pre-Feasibility in the Northwest Gulf of Mexico
Project Summary: Demonstrate that saline and depleted hydrocarbon storage reservoirs within a storage complex can store industrial CO2 emissions safely, permanently, and economically.

Project Name: Integrated Commercial Carbon Capture and Storage Pre-Feasibility Study at Dry Fork Station, Wyoming
Project Summary: Identify saline storage opportunities proximal to the Dry Fork Station (DFS) power plant in the Powder River Basin.

Project Name: Integrated Mid-Continent Stacked Carbon Storage Hub
Specific Site Location: Mid-Continent Region of the United States
Project Summary: This project is to study the pre-feasibility of an integrated CO2 storage hub in the mid-continent region of the United States, with the ultimate objective of storing anthropogenic CO2.

Project Name: Integrated Pre-Feasibility Study for CO2 Geological Storage in the Cascadia Basin, Offshore Washington State and British Columbia
Project Summary: Conduct a comprehensive assessment to determine the suitability of an ocean basalt reservoir in the Cascadia Basin offshore from Washington State and British Columbia for the safe and permanent storage of 50 million tons of carbon dioxide.

Project Name: Integrated Pre-Feasibility Study of a Commercial-Scale Commercial Carbon Capture Project in Formations of the Rock Springs Uplift, Wyoming
Project Summary: Perform a phase I pre-feasibility assessment for secure, commercial-scale CO2 capture and storage at the Rock Springs Uplift (RSU), Wyoming.
EPRI, along with other corporations and companies, is conducting a study on impacts and ability of retrofitting advanced amine-based CO2 capture technology with current plants.

Project Name: ION Engineering Commercial Carbon Capture Design & Costing (C3DC)
Plant Name: Gerald Gentleman Station Unit 2, Nebraska Public Power District
Project Summary: 300-MW slip stream project, will address market requests to provide their CO2 for EOR opportunities.
Proposal is to add on to long-planned Circulating Fluidized Bed (CFB) combustion unit added to existing plant, replacing two older coal-fired boilers.

CO2 captured from a PC plant in Harbin to be transported 100 km west to heavy-oil field in Daqing. The field produces more than 40 million metric tons (> 316 million barrels/yr); the CO2-enabled EOR is expected to boost output by 1.5 to 2 million metric tons/yr.

Company: JAPEX - Japan Petroleum Exploration Co., Ltd.
Project Summary: Plans to develop a carbon capture business and seeks to lead a project to trap and store pollution from coal-fired power plants in oil wells in northeastern China.
The Yubari project is a research and development project on CO2 sequestration in unmineable coal seams with the production of coal bed methane.

Project is in 2 phases. Phase I will inject 200K metric tons and Phase II will increase to 800K to 1 million tons/year. Pipeline is expected to be 21 miles long. Cumulative CO2 injection of one million metric tons was reached in the first half of 2016.

First EOR in Canada in the Joffre Viking field east of Red Deer, Alberta. Penn West Petroleum operates the project using CO2 from two of the Nova Chemical Corp Ethylene plants. Project End Date: December 31, 2011.
CO2 injections will continue until second quarter of 2009 and monitoring of operations will be from 2009-2010.

The goal is to test the potential of storing CO2 in a depleted gas field and evaluate the potential for enhanced gas recovery (EGR). The K12-B platform is compressing the CO2 and injecting it into the gas fields for storage and monitoring along with EGR.
The Karsto NGCC Power plant will have a CO2 capture pilot plant connected to the facility to demonstrate CO2 capture and seabed or EOR storage. Delayed in 2009 with no update on when it will start.
The first Zero-Emission Energy-Carbochemical Complex in the world. Also, they are planning the construction of a CO2 pipeline to a suitable storage area. Plant will burn up to 10% biomass fuel.
Combined Cycle portion of the plant operating on natural gas only without capture.
Filed for air permit in December 2008. Build with CCS capability. Funding CCS research in western Kentucky through Kentucky Geological Survey. The CO2 test well will monitor 1,500 tons of CO2.

The five-month test will employ Aker’s mobile test unit to investigate the effectiveness of the company’s amine-based CO2 capture technology for use on waste-to-energy plants. Several alternate capture techs will be sampled.

Proposed plan to construct a 300 coal-fired or IGCC plant and capture CO2 using either post-combustion. 1.2 million metric tons per year of CO2 will be transported to one of 4 saline aquifers under review. Sites have not been selected.
Capture from a chemical plant in Kurosaki. Able to capture 283 metric tons CO2/day and maximum of 330 metric tons CO2/day.

The Kwinana project will create hydrogen from coal gasification to produce 500 MW of electricity. The captured CO2 is transported offshore to be sequestered in the Perth Basin. The geological rock formation in the basin contained "gas chimneys."

Project Name: Large Pilot Testing of Linde/BASF Advanced Post-Combustion CO2 Capture Technology at a Coal-Fired Power Plant
Project Summary: Design an amine-based CO2 capture pilot-scale (10 MWe) system at an existing coal-fired power plant.

Project Name: Large Pilot Testing of the MTR Membrane Post-Combustion CO2 Capture Process
Project Summary: Design a 200 metric ton of CO2 per day large-pilot capture system at a coal-fired power plant operated by NRG Energy.

Project Name: Ledvice CEZ Capture and Storage Project
Project Summary: CEZ Group is proposing that the Czech Republic utilize part of its emission credits (Kyoto Protocol) to design CCS technologies for the Ledvice power plant.

Proposed SNG plant to use petroleum coke to produce methane and make synthetic natural gas. The CO2 can be pumped into oil fields to extract crude oil more efficiently. The plant would demonstrate large-scale recovery of 4 million tons per year of CO2.

Will utilize power and chemical coproduction plants to capture up to 1 million metric tons CO2 and transport via pipeline to use in EOR. Also constructing a 1,300-MW ultra pulverized coal power plant.

The project injected flue gas into a depleting oil field for EOR. It started in 1998 and the EOR proved effective with injecting flue gas. Phase II will look at separating CO2 via membrane and recirculating the CO2 to increase CO2 concentration.

Primary production of the Lima Energy IGCC project will be 540 MW of electrical power, 26 BCF/year of synthetic natural gas, and 6 million SCF/day of hydrogen. The CO2 will be used for sequestration or EOR.

Linc Energy has commenced the injection of CO2 into its first well in its Glenrock, Wyoming, oil fields. Linc Energy expects to recover more than 80 million barrels of oil. CO2 will be delivered at a rate of 1 to 3 bpm.

Capture Technology: Fluor Corporation’s advanced Econamine FG Plussm Technology
Project Summary: CO2 recovered from the exhaust of NH3 reformer unit by a scrubber based on Fluor's Econamine FG Process is used in urea production. The Luzhou plant produces 400,000 t/y synthetic ammonia and 520,000 t/y urea.

Plant Name: Emirates Steel's Mussafah Rolling Mill, a Gas-Fired Power Plant, Aluminum Smelter, EMAL Power Plant
Specific Site Location: Emirates Steel, Mussafah; UAE (United Arab Emirates) Khalifa Port; Industrial Zone (KPIZ) Taweelah
Project Summary: Capture 5 million t/y of CO2 gas from three sources: a gas-fired power plant and an aluminum smelter, both located at Taweelah, and a steel mill located at Mussafah. Captured CO2 to be sold, piped, and used for EOR. Phase 1 is capture from steel mill.
CO2 capture facility (10 tons per day) installed to understand long-term effects of impurities on amine scrubber process. Test occurred from July 2006 through 2008.

Project Name: Membrane-Sorbent Hybrid System for Post-Combustion Carbon Capture
Project Summary: 1 MWe - Test transformational solvent-based CO2 capture technologies at engineering scales using existing infrastructure, or membrane-based approaches that can be built and tested at a relevant scale that can be easily replicated for larger systems.
The plant will use ConocoPhillips E-Gas technology for gasification of coal. Primary and backup sites have been selected.

Project Name: MGSC Development Phase - Illinois Basin Decatur Project
Project Summary: MGSC has partnered with the Archer Daniels Midland (ADM) Company, an agricultural product processing company, to conduct a large-volume, saline sequestration test at ADM’s ethanol by fermentation facility located in Decatur, Illinois.

This mature oil field enhanced oil recovery (EOR) test, also known as a “Huff ’n Puff,” evaluated the potential for geological sequestration of CO2 in mature Illinois Basin oil reservoirs as part of an EOR program.

Project Name: MGSC Validation Phase - Mumford Hills Field
Project Summary: Carbon dioxide injection started in Fall 2009 at the EOR II site in the Mumford Hills field in Posey County, Indiana. The reservoir is located at an average depth of 1,900 feet deep and consists of thick wedges of fine-grained sandstone.

Project Name: MGSC Validation Phase - Sugar Creek Field
Project Summary: In early Summer 2009, CO2 injection started at the EOR III site in the Sugar Creek field in Hopkins County, Kentucky. The reservoir is located at a depth of 1,850 feet and consists of fine-grained sandstone packages interbedded with shales.

The purpose of this project was to determine the CO2 injection and storage capability and the enhanced coalbed methane recovery potential of Illinois Basin coal seams. The target formation was the Pennsylvanian Carbondale formation.
The Mitchell Energy Bridgeport, Texas USA plant recovered ~500 ton/day CO2 for EOR.

Project Name: Modeling CO2 Sequestration in a Saline Reservoir and Depleted Oil Reservoir to Evaluate The Regional CO2 Sequestration Potential of The Ozark Plateau Aquifer System, South-Central Kansas
Project Summary: This project studied potential CO2 storage sites within saline aquifer and depleted oil reservoirs within the Ozark Plateau Aquifer System (OPAS) in south-central Kansas.

Project Name: Monash Energy C to L CO2 Capture and Storage Project
Plant Name: Monash Energy Latrobe Valley CTL Plant
Project Summary: The project planned to build a coal-to-liquids plant with CCS demonstration plant using brown coal as the feedstock.

Project Name: Mongstad Cogeneration Plant with CO2 Storage
Plant Name: Mongstad Combined Heat and Power Plant
Project Summary: Full-scale capture and storage plans were cancelled. It was to capture approximately 1.5 million metric tons CO2/yr.

Project Name: Moomba Cooper Basin Carbon Storage Project
Project Summary: Moomba Carbon Storage (MCS) project is planning to store CO2 (20 million metric tons per year for over 50 years) in the Cooper Basin in central Australia that includes EOR.
MOVECBM is studying optimum CO2 storage and enhanced coal bed methane production (ECBM) in coal seams. The project lasted for two years ending in 2008.

Project Name: MRCSP Development Phase - Michigan Basin Project
Project Summary: Performing injection test of at least 1 million metric tons of CO2 into geologic formations associated with EOR.

Project Name: MRCSP Validation Phase - Appalachian Basin Test
Project Summary: This project provided an opportunity to evaluate the feasibility of injecting CO2 into three different deep rock formations at depths between 5,900 and 8,300 feet. These formations, the Oriskany, Salina, and Clinton/Medina.

Project Name: MRCSP Validation Phase - Cincinnati Arch Geologic Test
Project Summary: This saline formation project aims to demonstrate carbon sequestration in the Mt. Simon sandstone formation, a major CO2 sequestration target in the MRCSP region. Site is at Duke Energy's East Bend Generating Station.

Project Name: MRCSP Validation Phase - Michigan Basin Geologic Test
Plant Name: Turtle Lake Natural Gas Processing Plant
Project Summary: This project involves total injection of approximately 60,000 metric tons of CO2 into a saline formation between depths of 3,400 to 3,500 feet. The test location is the Charlton 30/31 field in Otsego County, Michigan, site of an enhanced oil recovery.

Company: CO2CRC - Cooperative Research Centre for Greenhouse Gas Technologies
Project Summary: Pre-combustion CO2 capture from a brown coal-burning IGCC plant. They are piloting three capture technologies: solvent, membrane, and pressure swing. CO2 captured (Metric Tons Total): 741 metric tons/year.

Plant Name: Teikoku Oil Co. Ltd. Natural Gas Field
Project Summary: Project is a small-scale field test of CO2 injection into an onshore saline formation 1,100 meters deep. The site was a horizontal homogeneous, high porosity, and permeability Pleistocene sandstone formation. Total of 10,405 metric tons of CO2 injected.
The plant has been used to develop and test solvent CO2 capture techniques. The CO2 is captured from a natural gas-fired boiler.

Project Name: Nebraska Integrated Carbon Capture and Storage Pre-Feasibility Study
Company: Energy & Environmental Research Center - University of North Dakota
Project Summary: Explore the viability of a commercial-scale carbon capture storage (CCS) project in western Nebraska.

Project Name: Newark Basin Characterization of New York and New Jersey
Project Summary: Goal is to characterize and assess the potential for storing large amounts of CO2 within the saline formations of the Newark Rift Basin.

Plant Name: Nippon Steel Facilities in Kimitsu Works
Project Summary: Project started in 2004 and plans to end in 2008. April 2010 will start a 30 metric tons/day capture test plant using amine solvent.
CEZ Group is planning to join a planned construction of demonstration low-emission units within the EU.

Project Name: North Dakota Integrated Carbon Storage Complex Feasibility Study
Company: Energy & Environmental Research Center - University of North Dakota
Project Summary: Determine the feasibility of developing a commercial-scale CO2 geologic storage complex in the Broom Creek Formation in central North Dakota.

Project Name: Northern Michigan Basin CarbonSAFE Integrated Pre-Feasibility Project
Project Summary: Battelle will carry out studies to establish the feasibility of developing an integrated commercial-scale carbon capture and storage (CCS) site that will utilize deep geologic strata in the Northern Michigan Basin.
The gasification process will break apart the bitumen to produce hydrogen and CO2. The CO2 is in a purchase agreement with Enhance Energy.
NRG Energy planned to construct an IGCC plant in New York. The project was canceled in 2008.

NRG Corp of Canada planned to install their plasma gasification technology at Somerset and build a 120-MW coal and biomass unit. Received regulatory approval form Mass. DEP January 25, 2009. Permit application withdrawn on February 3, 2011.
EPRI and five electric utilities in the United States and Canada will host studies of CCS retrofit impacts on existing power plants.

Project Name: Nuon Magnum IGCC Plant with Capture Option
Project Summary: In 2011, Nuon said it was postponing coal gasification technology to at least 2020.

Specific Site Location: near Roermond in Limburg, the Netherlands
Project Summary: With the pilot in Buggenum, Nuon intends to make CO2 capture technology suitable for the energy sector. The knowledge and experience can then be applied in the new power plant Nuon Magnum in the Eemshaven in Groningen.

Natural gas plant successful capture of vent stack CO2 flowing from a natural gas processing plant to an EOR site. The plant will use membrane separation and transport the CO2 over a 16-mile pipeline.
The coal to liquids (CTL) plant will use about 4.1 million MT coal/year to produce 24,000 Barrels/Day. The plant separated and injected 170,000 tons CO2 into the Ordos Basin.

Company: CO2CRC - Cooperative Research Centre for Greenhouse Gas Technologies
Project Summary: Stage 1 of the Otway project is in the post-injection monitoring phase (CO2 injection into a depleted gas field). Stage 2 of the Otway project is beginning with an evaluation of residual gas trapping in saline formations.

Plant Name: 300-MWe Demo Plant at the Compostilla Power Station
Project Summary: 300-MWe Circulating Fluidized Bed (CFB) supercritical oxy-combustion plant, with CO2 storage in a deep saline formation. Project has been divided into two distinct phases to significantly reduce the economic and technical risks.

Project Name: PCOR Development Phase - Bell Creek Project
Company: Energy & Environmental Research Center - University of North Dakota
Project Summary: The project brought CO2 from the Lost Cabin gas plant in north-central Wyoming through a 226-mile pipeline. The CO2 will be used for EOR. 900,000 metric tons CO2 per year will be used to recover an incremental 35 million bbl over 20-25 years.

Project Name: PCOR Development Phase - Ft. Nelson Project
Company: Energy & Environmental Research Center - University of North Dakota
Project Summary: The Fort Nelson project will utilize more than 1 million tons of CO2 per year captured from one of the largest gas processing plants in North America. The CO2 will be compressed and transported in pipeline to the injection site.

Company: Energy & Environmental Research Center - University of North Dakota
Project Summary: Approximately 82 metric tons (90 tons) of CO2 was injected over a roughly two-week period into a 10- to 12-foot-thick coal seam at a depth of approximately 1,100 feet. Test affirmed CO2 can be safely stored in coal.

Project Name: PCOR Validation Phase - Northwest McGregor EOR Huff n' Puff Project
Company: Energy & Environmental Research Center - University of North Dakota
Project Summary: Eagle Operating and the EERC conducted a CO2 “Huff n’ Puff” in the Northwest McGregor Oil Field on the Nesson Anticline in Williston County, North Dakota. A total of 400 metric tons of CO2  was injected into the Madison formation over two days in July 2009.

Project Name: PCOR Validation Phase - Zama Field Test
Company: Energy & Environmental Research Center - University of North Dakota
Project Summary: The field validation test conducted at Apache Canada’s Zama oil field in Alberta, Canada, is evaluating the potential for geologic sequestration of CO2 in an acid gas stream that also includes high concentrations of hydrogen sulfide (H2S).

Company: PennWest Exploration (formerly Penn West Energy Trust)
Project Summary: Penn West initiated a CO2 pilot project in 2005 and the first phase of the Pembina Enhanced Recovery Project will include construction of a CO2 supply pipeline, infill drilling, well recompletions, and field facility upgrades.

Plant Name: Gas Separation at Carmito Gas Field
Project Summary: The project is injecting 40 Mcf per day into Carmito field for EOR/EGR

Intend to build the first of a new generation of CO2 storage facilities in two depleted natural-gas fields in Barendrecht. Build a gasification hydrogen plant at Pernis Refinery, use excess gas at a 177-MWe IGCC plant, and use the CO2 in gas fields.

Project Name: Petrobras Lula Oil Field Offshore CCS Project
Plant Name: CO2 Reinjection from Lula Oil Field
Project Summary: Petrobras has begun CO2 re-injection from an off-shore gas extraction platform in 2013. CO2 is found with the natural gas located within the Lula Oil Field. The CO2 will be captured during gas extraction and then re-injected to enhance NG extraction.

Project involves testing three different storage scenarios - namely EOR, depleted gas reservoir, and saline aquifer storage. The goal is to develop technologies that could be used in to mitigate emissions from the Santos basin’s pre-salt cluster of fields.
Performing a feasibility study to design a zero emission plant. The plant will be supplied with CO2 rich gas from one of Petrom’s fields. CO2 from plant will be reinjected into an oil field for EOR.
Petronas fertilizer plant produces ammonia and urea for fertilizer manufacture. The plant produces 3,400 Nm3/h CO2 with 99.9% purity (160 t/d or approx. 60,000 tons/year).

Project Name: Phulpur Urea Plant CO2 Recovery project
Project Summary: MHI has provided technology to Indian Farmers Fertilizer Cooperative Limited (IFFCO) for two 450-MT/d CO2 recovery units for its two urea production plants completed at the end of last year.

Project focused on identifying sites in France as potential geologic storage sites and optimize site evaluation processes for a CO2 project. The project was completed in 2006. PICOREF will continue in 2006-2007 within the French National Research Agency.

The project had been terminated. The study suggested that although the technology works and capital costs were in-line with expectations, the market for carbon sales and the price of emissions reductions were insufficient to allow the project to proceed.
Due to permitting and legislation issues, the final investment decision has been delayed until 2016.

Company: CSIRO - Australian Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organization
Project Summary: This is a post-combustion capture process at a Huaneng Beijing Co-Generation power plant fitted with liquid CO2 capture technology. The pilot plant plans to capture about 3,000 metric tons of CO2 per year and it is used in the food industry.

Initial proposal was to run the demonstration project in the Tuxpan Power Plant that would be refitted to use coal as primary source. Due to CFE strategic decisions, it was decided to have the CCS project in the NGCC Power Plant located at Poza Rica.
Plant will have 15% less CO2 than typical U.S. coal plant. Pending decision on capture technology. The plant will use 'supercritical' boilers to combust coal.

Project Name: Praxair Inc. CO2 Capture and Sequestration Project
Plant Name: BP Refinery and Hydrogen Production Facility
Project Summary: This DOE Phase I ICCS project was selected for Phase I but not for Phase II.

Aim of project is to validate at industrial scale, H2 co-production and CO2 capture (from coal and petcoke) integrated with electricity production in and existing commercial IGCC. Goal is to capture 100 tpd of CO2 and produce 200 t of H2 per day.

Plant Name:
Koch Nitrogen’s
Knoch Nitrogen - Enid Fertilizer Plant
Project Summary: Captured CO2 from a Fertilizer Plant in Enid, Oklahoma. CO2 transported ~120 miles to the Northeast Purdy Unit and Bradley Unit for EOR.

Build a coal-fired electric plant in Linden, New Jersey, that would capture its emissions of carbon dioxide and pump the pollutant 70 miles offshore for sequestration in a sandstone approximately 1 mile beneath ocean floor.
This is a Chinese-Canadian collaborating project. Starting in April 2004, a total of 192 metric tons CO2 was injected into the coalbed.
In 1997, AGA entered an agreement whereby it would build a flue-gas CO2 recovery unit and ultimately deliver quantities of food grade CO2 for soft drinks manufacturers in the area.

Project Name: Quest Carbon Capture and Storage Project
Project Summary: The Quest Carbon Capture and Storage Project will reduce CO2 emissions from Shell’s oil sands operations by more than one million metric tons a year by capturing CO2 from its Scotford upgrader and permanently storing it deep underground.

Continued carbon dioxide flooding and drilling of more wells helps maintain production at 14,000 barrels a day. Cumulative production of 860 million barrels makes the field the most prolific in the Rocky Mountains in 2005.

The project conducted research and pilot field tests storing CO2 in coal seams in the Silesian coal basin of Poland. Over a time period from August 2004 to June 2005, a total of 760 metric tons CO2 was injected into the well.
Initial development plans for CO2 capture from the Riley Ridge Gas plant envisaged a 2015-17 start-up date. Denbury has indicated that the new plan is for a 2020 development timeline.
RWE is planning a 1,600-MW coal- and biomass-fired power plant in Eemshaven together with a 200,000 ton per year (equivalent to 35 MW) post-combustion CO2 capture R&D unit.

Project Name: RWE IGCC Plant with CO2 Storage
Project Summary: The project will be a large-scale, coal-fired power plant that combines coal gasification (IGCC), CO2 separation, and CO2 storage in a saline aquifer. CO2 will be delivered to the storage site through a 540-km pipeline.

Project Name: RWE nPower - Aberthaw Capture Project in UK
Project Summary: RWE npower is building a combined SO2 and CO2 capture pilot plant at the UK Aberthaw coal-fired power plant. It will be a 3-MW plant that will capture up to 50 metric tons of CO2 per day.
It may eventually install CCS equipment once the technology is "proven." Capture technology was able to capture 90% CO2. Project stopped due to uncertain economic climate in 2009.

Project Name: RWE nPower - Tilbury Project in UK
Project Summary: Plant could reduce emissions by 90%. A key of the study is to look at the transportation options and storage in geological formations for possible EOR or EGR.
The pilot plant is capturing 300 kg CO2/hr from a bypass flue gas stream from the plant.
SEI S.p.A. (Milan) was planning the construction of a modern coal-fired power plant with an installed capacity of 1,320 MW on an unused industrial area in Saline Joniche.

Project Name: Salt Creek, Monell, Sussex Unit EOR
Project Summary: CO2 is piped 125 miles to the site and is sequestered about 579 meters into sandstone reservoir for EOR in Salt Creek and Monel reservoirs.

Project Name: Sargas Husnes Norwegian Clean Coal Plant Project
Project Summary: The plant has been on hold since 2008. Was to capture about 2.6 million metric tons of CO2/yr for EOR in North Sea oil fields.

The project's patented designs capture 90% of the CO2 and virtually eliminates NOx, SOx, and Hg emissions, whether applied to greenfield or retrofitted plants. Sargas and Shell have announced plans to construct a plant with CO2 capture.

SARGAS currently has a breakthrough, proprietary technology for CO2 capture, which can be used at coal at a very affordable price. The challenge lies in how the large amounts of CO2 to be stored, and who takes the bill for disposal.

SaskPower had planned to implement a 300-MW clean coal plant that would capture about 8,000 metric tons of CO2 a day for EOR and/or sequestration. Project rejected due to capital cost and uncertainty of the economic value of CO2 reduction.

Project Name: Scale-Up and Testing of Advanced Polaris Membrane CO2 Capture Technology
Project Summary: Test transformational solvent-based CO2 capture technologies at engineering-scales using existing infrastructure, or membrane-based approaches that can be built and tested at a relevant scale that can be easily replicated for larger systems.
The plant will use oxyfuel technology to separate out CO2, and the captured CO2, will be transported by truck, is to be stored in a gas field in Altmark.

Project Name: Scottish and Southern Energy - West Yorkshire
Project Summary: In capturing 100 metric tons of CO2 daily, the plant bridges the gap between small pilot trials that are underway and the commercial-scale demonstration projects. CO2 is to be stored in North Sea

Scottish Power plans to convert the plant from coal to  combined cycle gas turbine reducing carbon emissions. The plant will be carbon capture ready and required to fit full carbon capture and storage technology once it is commercially available.
A decision has been made not to proceed with Longannet but to pursue other projects with the £1bn funding made available by the government.
Project was to convert the plant to a supercritical coal plant and capture CO2 and sequester it in a depleted oil field in the North Sea.
The CO2 is captured from the flue gas of a coal power plant.
Injection operations were initiated in September 2012, with approximately 110,000 metric tons injected to date. Post-injection operations to be completed in September 2017.
To date, the project has injected over 8 million metric tons of CO2 (through 23 injection wells) into the stacked storage regime within the Tuscaloosa formation at the Cranfield Site.

Project Name: SECARB Validation Phase - Black Warrior Basin Project
Project Summary: As in the Central Appalachian Basin, the objectives of the Black Warrior Basin test were to determine if sequestration of CO2 in mature CBM reservoirs is a safe and effective method to mitigate GHG emissions and to determine if injectivity exists.

Project Name: SECARB Validation Phase - Central Appalachian Basin Coal Test
Project Summary: The project evaluated the injection of more than 900 metric tons of CO2 into multiple coal seams of the Pocahontas Formation and Lee Formation at depths ranging between 1,400 and 2,200 feet.

Project Name: SECARB Validation Phase - Plant Daniel Project
Project Summary: The primary objective of this project was to locate and evaluate suitable saline formations for storage of CO2 in close proximity to large coal-fired power plants along the Mississippi Gulf Coast.

Project Name: SECARB Validation Phase - Stacked Storage Test
Project Summary: Initiated injection of CO2 for the storage/EOR activity on July 15, 2008. As of March 2009, approximately 627,744 metric tons of CO2 have been injected.
This project would make SGS Unit 3 (750 MW) the first electric generating unit in Florida to propose installing a carbon dioxide capture demonstration project.

SEQ Nederland B.V. and ONS Energy are planning to build Zero Emission Power Plant (ZEPP) in Drachten, Netherlands, producing 50 MW using a novel oxy-fuel technology. 250,000 metric tons annually CO2 will be captured and used for EGR in nearby gas fields.

Company: Shanxi International Energy Group Company, Ltd (SIEG)
Project Summary: Air Products performed the feasibility and cost study in 2014. No further info regarding the project.

Specific Site Location: Between Baton Rouge and New Orleans
Project Summary: This DOE Phase I ICCS project was selected for Phase I but not for Phase II.

Specific Site Location: Northwest China's Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region
Project Summary: Coal gasification (using Seimen's IGCC to syngas process) to produce hydrocarbon liquids/gases and to capture 2 million metric tons per annum (Mtpa) CO2 using physical solvent-based absorption process. CO2 capture date to start 2020.
CO2 capture and storage has been utilized at the facility since 1987, mostly used for EOR.
The Mikawa pilot plant is designed to capture 10 tons of CO2 a day from flue gas of the boiler of the coal-fired thermal power plant.
Three GE gasifiers supply syngas to fertilizer mfg. The next project would capture and compress CO2 for EOR use, after transportation of 47 miles.

Project Name: Sinopec Shengli Power Plant CCS Project
Plant Name: Sinopec Shengli Power Plant CCS Project
Project Summary: Flue gas desulfurization (FGD) and De-NOx units are equipped to the Phase III power Production Units, with typical post-combustion CO2 capture process is used in the project. For EOR. May also be called Shengli Dongying power station.

Project Name: Site Characterization for CO2 Storage from Coal-Fired Power Facilities in the Black Warrior Basin of Alabama
Project Summary: This project assessed CO2 storage capacity in the Black Warrior Basin. Test well drilled at the Alabama Power Goras Plant.

Project Name: Site Characterization of the Highest-Priority Geologic Formations for CO2 Storage in Wyoming
Project Summary: Characterization of the Rock Springs Uplift (RSU) and Moxa Arch deep saline reservoirs in southwestern Wyoming to pave the way for commercial-scale CO2 sequestration projects.

The Sleipner West natural gas field in the North Sea produces CO2 from the gas. The CO2 is separated from the gas and reinjected into the Sleipner West gas field in the Utrisa formation to meet specifications.

Project Name: Slipstream Development and Testing of Siemens POSTCAP Capture and Separation Technology
Plant Name: Tampa Electric Company's Big Bend Station
Project Summary: Design, install, and operate a pilot plant treating 2.5 MWe slipstream of flue gas.

Project Name: Slipstream Testing of a Membrane CO2 Capture Process for Existing Coal-Fired Power Plants
Project Summary: 1 tpd capture field test site Cholla Power Plant (AZ), with scale-up to 20 tons/day at NCCC site.

Project Name: Snøhvit Field LNG and CO2 Storage Project
Plant Name: Snøhvit Field and Hammerfest LNG Plant
Project Summary: Snøhvit gas field developed by Statoil is in the Barents Sea where gas is extracted and the CO2 is separated from the gas and injected into Tubasen sandstone formation 2,600 m below the seabed. Gas is transported to shore to strip the CO2 and produce LNG.

Proposed plan to construct a 300-MW oxy-fuel or IGCC plant and capture CO2 using either pre- or oxy-fuel combustion. 1.2 million metric tons per year of CO2 will be transported by ship and stored in saline aquifers. Sites have not been selected.
CO2 scrubbing system installed for treatment of flue gases generated from onsite boilers and coal/oil boilers. Approx 150 metric tons/day of CO2 captured.

Project Name: Summit Energy - Texas Clean Energy Project (TCEP)
Project Summary: Summit's Texas Clean Energy Project (TCEP), dubbed a "NowGen" plant by national environmental group the Clean Air Task Force, will be a new 400-MW coal gasification plant. The project was discontinued in 2015.

The Timor field holds about 5.4 trillion cubic feet of gas. The project will take natural gas and convert it into LNG. Currently considering if they will convert to LNG on a floating platform or ship natural gas via pipeline to a land-based plant.

Located near Wandoan in Queensland’s Surat Basin, the project is a proposed 400-MW power station using IGCC with carbon capture and storage technologies. They also will examine promising potential CO2 sinks.

Project Name: Swan Hills In-Situ Coal Gasification/Sagitawah Power Project
Project Summary: The project will use In Situ Coal Gasification to tap deep, unmineable coal to produce syngas that will be processed in a conventional gas plant to remove CO2 as a byproduct stream. Project on hold due to low natural gas prices.
ConocoPhillips is no longer pursuing the IGCC plant, and formally withdrew the air permit application for the project on April 13, 2012.

Project Name: SWP Development Phase - Farnsworth Unit Ochiltree Project
Company: New Mexico Institute of Mining and Technology
Plant Name: Arkalon Ethanol Plant and Agrium Fertilizer Plant
Project Summary: This project seeks to injection approximately 1 million metric tons of CO2 into the Morrow Sandstone (part of the Farnsworth Unit of the Anadarko Basin in northern Texas) for the purpose of EOR activities.

Project Name: SWP Validation Phase - Aneth EOR Sequestration Project
Company: New Mexico Institute of Mining and Technology
Project Summary: Starting in August 2007, SWP tested EOR combined with sequestration by injecting CO2 into the Desert Creek and Ismay producing zone, approximately 5,800 feet deep, in the Aneth Oil Field in San Juan County.

Project Name: SWP Validation Phase - Pump Canyon CO2-ECBM Sequestration Demonstration
Company: New Mexico Institute of Mining and Technology
Project Summary: The San Juan Basin pilot test examined ECBM efficacy and degree of CO2 sequestration by injecting CO2 sourced from the McElmo Dome into the coals of the Upper Cretaceous Fruitland formation in the San Juan Basin.

Project Name: SWP Validation Phase - SACROC CO2 Injection Project
Company: New Mexico Institute of Mining and Technology
Project Summary: This test included a post-audit modeling analysis of injected CO2 for EOR over the last 30 years at the SACROC Unit in the Permian Basin of Texas, in addition to intense MVA analyses of ongoing CO2 injection at SACROC.

Planning a trial carbon capture programme at its Taichung coal-fired power station. The captured CO2 will be injected below the seabed off Taiwan’s west coast for permanent storage. The project will capture 10,000 metric tons of CO2 from the plant by 2014.

Project Name: Tampa Electric - Scale-Up of High-Temperature Syngas Cleanup Technology
Project Summary: The project designed, constructed, and operated a pre-commercial scale high-temperature syngas cleanup unit with integrated CCS technology. 300,000 tons CO2 total were injected into a saline formation.
A one hectare project will use the power station's CO2-laden flue-gas to feed a Bio-CCS Algal Synthesizer.

Tenaska announced that it was cancelling both of its CCS projects on June 2013. Taylorville and Trailblazer were both cut from Tenaska's portfolio in favor of renewable and gas-fired power generation.
Tested five solvent systems for their CO2 capture capability. Selected best solvent (H3) and it consistently achieved 80% to 90% recovery rates.

Total has initiated a pilot CO2 capture and sequestration project in the Lacq basin. The project will inject up to 150,000 metric tons of CO2 into a depleted natural gas field in Rousse over a period of two years from 2010 to 2012. The project is ongoing.
The project is pumping CO2 from greenhouse furnaces into algae ponds to take advantages of CCUS opportunities with biomass to energy (biodiesel) production.

Capture Technology: Fluor Corporation’s Advanced Econamine FG Plussm Technology
Project Summary: In 2013 Tenaska cancelled the Trailblazer Energy Center project.

The project is separating CO2 from CH4 on surface, and reinject back into deeper reservoirs for EOR. The project is currently conducting a feasibility study. Up to 150,000 cubic meters per day injected.

Project Name: UKy-CAER Heat-Integrated Transformative CO2 Capture Process for Pulverized Coal Power Plants
Plant Name: Trimble County Generating Station LG&E and KU
Capture Technology: UKy-CAER Heat-Integrated Transformative CO2 Capture Process
Project Summary: Selected for Phase I (Feasibility); Two projects to be downselected for Phase III (Construction/Operation).
Project was to store over 700,000 metric tons/year and is considered cancelled. The overall effort was to reduce current CO2 emissions from steel making by 50%.
Conceptual study has been completed and the project is feasible. Project would store CO2 in Kish Bank Basin.

Project Name: University of Kansas - Small-Scale Injection Project
Plant Name: Carbon Storage Operations Within the Arbuckle Saline Reservoir and the Wellington Field for EOR
Project Summary: This project will inject 40,000 metric tons of supercritical CO2 into the Arbuckle saline aquifer, and 30,000 metric tons of supercritical CO2 into the oil-bearing dolomite within the Wellington Field. DOE project completed September 30, 2017.

Plant Name: Hawiyah Natural Gas Liquids Recovery Plant
Project Summary: CO2 gas separation process capture and 70 km transport to injection in Uthmaniyah Field for EOR and storage purposes.

Plant Name: Val Verde Natural Gas Plants (Terrell, Gray Ranch, Mitchell, Puckett)
Project Summary: Four different NG processing plants contribute to CO2 pipeline (Terrell, Gray Ranch, Mitchell, Puckett). Oldest CO2 pipeline in the United States, began distribution to west Texas oilfields in 1972.

Project Name: Vales Point Power Station CCS Demonstration
Project Summary: Pilot capture plant will be moved from Munmorah to Vales power station between 2013 and 2015. It will demonstrate capture and storage of up to 3,000 metric tons per year.

The feasibility studies for the demonstration plant in Jänschwalde will begin in mid 2008. From early 2009 the planning and applications for permits will be the centre of activities. CO2 will be used for EGR in Altmark.

CO2 will be produced by the existing landfill biogas-to-energy units and the CO2 will be injected into a saline aquifer more then 1,500 meters deep. Project start-up from storage was estimated to begin in 2010.

Plant Name: CO2 Injection into the Oakwood or Sourwood Coal Seams in Central Appalachia
Project Summary: This project will evaluate unconventional carbon storage reservoirs (shales, coal seams) in Central Appalachia. The project proposes to inject 20,000 metric tons of supercritical CO2 into unmineable coal seams (Oakwood or Sourwood).

Project Name: W.A. Parish Post-Combustion CO2 Capture and Sequestration Project
Project Summary: Petra Nova Parish Holdings will retrofit a CO2 capture plant on an existing coal-fired power plant (W.A. Parish Generating Station) located in Thompsons, Texas, which is southwest of Houston. 90% capture of a 240-MWe flue stream.
The project was cancelled in 2008 with the reason given as "trouble obtaining drilling equipment."

Project Name: We Energies Pleasant Prairie Field Pilot
Project Summary: The Chilled Ammonia CO2 capture pilot at the We Energies power plant in Pleasant Prairie, Wisconsin, USA, went into operation in June 2008. Demonstrated more than 90% capture of CO2 from flue gas.

Project Name: West Texas and Llano Pipelines Power CCS
Project Summary: Trinity CO2 controls the CO2 pipelines for West Texas and Llano Pipelines. Their main CCS activities include pipeline developer, CO2 marketer, and CO2 aggregator. The CO2 is used primarily for EOR.

Project Name: WESTCARB Validation Phase - Arizona Utilities CO2 Storage Pilot
Project Summary: This project involved drilling a well approximately 3,800 feet deep to evaluate saline formation CO2 storage in Arizona’s Colorado Plateau region. Potential storage targets are the Naco and Martin formations. Insufficient permeability detected.

Project Name:
WESTCARB Validation Phase - Northern California CO2 Reduction Project
 Reduction Project (G1)
Specific Site Location: Montezuma Hills in Southern Sacramento Basin
Project Summary: The project team developed a 3D model based on well log and seismic survey data from natural gas exploration, production, and storage operations in the area. The team used the model to simulate a research-size injection of 5,440 metric tons of CO2.

Drilled through the Knox and Mount Simon formations and tested their potential to permanently store CO2. The well penetrated the Precambrian basement rocks. 323 tons of carbon dioxide were successfully injected into deep formations.

A large operational EOR with CO2 storage project in Weyburn and adjacent Midale fields. The projected production with EOR is 67 million barrels. CO2 is supplied by a 205-mile pipeline from the Great Plains Synfuel Plant in North Dakota, USA.
On November 25, 2015, the UK announced that it was cancelling the UK £1bn CCS Competition. To date there has been no announcement of the project's current status.

Project Name: Wolverine Power Supply Cooperative Inc. - Industrial Capture Project
Project Summary: This DOE Phase I ICCS project was selected for Phase I but not for Phase II.

Project Name: Yanchang Integrated Carbon Capture and Storage Demonstration Project
Project Summary: The second phase would capture 360,000 metric tons per annum of CO2 or greater from a gasification facility associated with industrial plants of the Shaanxi Yanchang-China National Coal Yulin Energy Chemical company. Construction has commenced.

Specific Site Location: Pecos County west of Iraan Texas
Project Summary: Kinder Morgan delivers approximately 1.3 billion cubic feet per day of CO2 through about 1,300 miles of pipelines.

Shenhua and Dow would likely form a 50:50 joint-venture company to build and operate the project which is planned to produce a large number of different chemicals. This project is still in the early stages of development.
Technology development, process design, and engineering began in 2007. May lead to development of a larger 200+ MW plant if successful.

Stage 1 of the project was planned to be 80 MW and capture 420,000 metric tons of CO2 per year and stage 2 was planned to be 300 MW. The first stage was scheduled to operate in 2012 and the scaled-up version in late 2015.
